plants.name: Peashooter
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>一How can a single plant grow and shoot so many peas so quickly? Peashooter says, "Hard work, commitment, and a healthy, well-balanced breakfast of sunlight and high-fiber carbon dioxide make it all possible."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Peashooters are your first line of defense. They shoot peas at attacking zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Sunflower
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Sunflower can't resist bouncing to the beat. Which beat is that? Why, the life-giving jazzy rhythm of the Earth itself, thumping at a frequency only Sunflower can hear.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sunflowers are essential for you to produce extra sun. Try planting as many as you can!

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry Bomb
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I wanna explode," says Cherry #1. "No, let's detonate instead!" says his brother, Cherry #2. After intense consultation, they agree to explodonate.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry Bombs can blow up all zombies in an area. They have a short fuse so plant them near zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color></size>

plants.name: Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"People wonder how I feel about getting constantly chewed on by zombies," says Wall-nut. "What they don't realize is that with my limited senses, all I can feel is a kind of tingling, like a relaxing back rub."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nuts have hard shells which you can use to protect your other plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color></size>

plants.name: Potato Mine
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Some folks say Potato Mine is lazy, that he leaves everything to the last minute. Potato Mine says nothing. He's too busy thinking about his investment strategy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mines pack a powerful punch, but they need a while to arm themselves. You should plant them ahead of zombies. They will explode on contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color></size>

plants.name: Chomper
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Chomper almost got a gig doing stunts for The Little Shop of Horrors but it fell through when his agent demanded too much on the front end. Chomper's not resentful, though. He says it's just part of the business.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chompers can devour a zombie whole, but they are vulnerable while chewing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color></size>

plants.name: Puff-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I only recently became aware of the existence of zombies," says Puff-shroom. "Like many fungi, I'd just assumed they were fairy tales or movie monsters. This whole experience has been a huge eye-opener for me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Puff-shrooms are cheap, but can only fire a short distance.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can stack up to three times.</color></size>

plants.name: Fume-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I was in a dead-end job producing yeast spores for a bakery," says Fume-shroom. "Then Puff-shroom, bless 'im, told me about this great opportunity blasting zombies. Now I really feel like I'm making a difference."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fume-shrooms shoot fumes that can pass through screen doors.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can pierce through.</color></size>

plants.name: Hypno-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Zombies are our friends," asserts Hypno-shroom. "They're badly misunderstood creatures who play a valuable role in our ecology. We can and should do more to bring them round to our way of thinking."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>When eaten, Hypno-shrooms will make a zombie turn around and fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Makes a single zombie fight for you.</color></size>

plants.name: Scaredy-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Who's there?" whispers Scaredy-shroom, voice barely audible. "Go away. I don't want to see anybody. Unless it's the man from the circus."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Scaredy-shrooms are long-ranged shooters that hide when enemies get near them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Ice-shroom frowns, not because he's unhappy or because he disapproves, but because of a childhood injury that left his facial nerves paralyzed.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ice-shrooms temporarily immobilize all zombies on the screen.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes all zombies in place.</color></size>

plants.name: Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"You're lucky I'm on your side," says Doom-shroom. "I could destroy everything you hold dear. It wouldn't be hard."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doom-shrooms destroy everything in a large area and leave a crater that can't be planted on.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Leaves a crater.</color></size>

plants.name: Lily Pad
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Lily Pad never complains. Lily Pad never wants to know what's going on. Put a plant on top of Lily Pad, he won't say a thing. Does he have startling opinions or shocking secrets? Nobody knows. Lily Pad keeps it all inside.</color></size>
plants.info: Lily Pads let you plant non-aquatic plants on top of them. Special: Non-aquatic plants can be planted on it. When specific plants are placed, Lily Pad transforms into a variant of it that can automatically plant the plant that transformed it every 90 seconds.

plants.name: Squash
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm ready!" yells Squash. "Let's do it! Put me in! There's nobody better! I'm your guy! C'mon! Whaddya waiting for? I need this!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squashes will smash the first zombie that gets close to it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color></size>

plants.name: Threepeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Threepeater likes reading, backgammon, and long periods of immobility in the park. Threepeater enjoys going to shows, particularly modern jazz. "I'm just looking for that special someone," he says. Threepeater's favorite number is 5.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Threepeaters shoot peas in three lanes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*3/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Tangle Kelp
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm totally invisible," Tangle Kelp thinks to himself. "I'll hide here just below the surface, and nobody will see me." His friends tell him they can see him perfectly well, but he'll never change.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tangle Kelp are aquatic plants that pull the first zombie that nears them underwater.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color></size>

plants.name: Jalapeno
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"NNNNNGGGGG...." Jalapeno says. He's not going to explode, not this time. But soon. Oh, so soon. It's close. He knows it; he can feel it; his whole life's been leading up to this moment.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Jalapenos destroy an entire row of zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color></size>

plants.name: Spikeweed
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Hockey is Spikeweed's obsession. He's got box seat season tickets. He keeps close track of his favorite players. And he consistently cleans up in the office hockey pool. Just one problem: he's terrified of pucks.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweeds pop tires and hurt any zombies that step on them

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Instakill Vehicle Zombies</color></size>

plants.name: Torchwood
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Everybody likes and respects Torchwood. They like him for his integrity, for his steadfast friendship, for his ability to greatly maximize pea damage. But Torchwood has a secret: He can't read.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Torchwoods turn peas that pass through them into fireballs that deal twice as much damage.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites peas that pass through it, increasing their damage.</color></size>

plants.name: Sea-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Sea-shroom has never seen the sea. It's in his name, he's heard loads about it, but he's just never found the time. One day, though, it'll go down.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sea-shrooms are aquatic plants that shoot short ranged spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Plantern
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Plantern defies science. He just does. Other plants eat light and excrete oxygen; Plantern eats darkness and excretes light. Plantern's cagey about how he does it. "I'm not gonna say 'sorcery,' I wouldn't use the term 'dark forces,' I just... I think I've said enough."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>Planterns light up an area to let you see through fog, and give Lumos levels to plants.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels the fog with light.</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Provides 1 Lumos Level in a 3x3 Grid, which can be stacked to provide strength to other Lumos plants. Refer to its fusions for the list of affected plants.</color></size>

plants.name: Cactus
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>She's prickly, sure, but Cactus' spikes belie a spongy heart filled with love and goodwill. She just wants to hug and be hugged. Most folks can't hang with that, but Cactus doesn't mind. She's been seeing an armadillo for a while and it really seems to be working out.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cactuses shoot spikes that can hit both ground and air targets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can attack flying zombies.</color></size>

plants.name: Blover
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>When Blover was five he got a shiny new birthday cake. Blover made his wish, huffed and puffed, but was able to extinguish only 60% of the candles. Instead of giving up, though, he's used that early defeat as a catalyst to push himself harder ever since.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blovers blow away all balloon zombies and fog, except Bucket-copter Zombies and Zomppelins.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Blows away fog and Balloon Zombies. Pushes back Zomppelins slightly.</color></size>

plants.name: Starfruit
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Aw, man," says Starfruit. "I went to the dentist the other day, and he said that I have four cavities. I've got—count it—ONE tooth! Four cavities in one tooth? How does this happen?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starfruits shoot stars in 5 directions.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*5/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Pumpkin had just wrapped up his part-time gig. "Honestly, it was a pretty fun experience," he chuckled. "But can someone explain why they kept stuffing candy and candles inside me?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pumpkins protect plants that are within their shells.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Fusion Priority: </color><color=#8B0000>Lowest</color></size>

plants.name: Magnet-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Everyone wondered why Magnet-shroom always took so long to "digest" the iron he absorbed, even after it had already been taken away for fusion. Frustrated, he snapped, "I'm not lazy! I just got knocked out by flying iron!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Magnet-shrooms can absorb metallic objects.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can attract metal objects.</color>
If there is a magnetic plant in the 8-direction vicinity of another magnetic plant, they are then connected through the Magnetic System. The Magnetic System has no limit to its number of connections, and will boost the strength of some magnetic plants based on its amount. Refer to its fusions for the list of affected plants.</size>

plants.name: Cabbage-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Some say love is like a cabbage; you have to peel it layer by layer to see the other person's heart. But Cabbage-pult has some reservations about this, as he is still single himself.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches cabbages to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>

plants.name: Flower Pot
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Plants always think Flower Pot is just a "pot," but in reality, Flower Pot is a "flower" that just looks like a "pot." Look, that little sprout is the bud of a flower.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Allows planting plants above it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Enables plants to be planted on rooftops.</color>

plants.name: Kernel-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Plants are curious where Kernel-pult's butter comes from. Kernel-pult doesn't know either, but that doesn't stop him from making popcorn with it in his spare time to earn a little extra cash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws corn kernels to attack zombies and can also throw butter to immobilize them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw butter, dealing 40 damage and immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds.<color=#8B0000></color>

plants.name: Garlic
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Garlic boasts of his high allicin content, claiming that eating garlic is good for health. Whether that's true or not, you only have to watch the zombies gagging as they chew on him to know it's pretty effective. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Any zombie that tries to bite it will switch lanes.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it will change lanes. </color>

plants.name: Umbrella Leaf
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Once a renowned passer, Umbrella Leaf was a superstar in the 114th Plant-Zombie NBA. But as he aged, he discovered he was going bald.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Deflects incoming basketballs.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can knock back basketballs within a 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Marigold
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Marigold is extraordinarily wealthy, so it spends freely—though technically, it doesn't even have hands or feet.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces coins, silver coins, and diamonds.

<color=black>Production Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Coin Amount:
</color><color=#8B0000>75% Chance = 100 Coins
20% Chance = 300 Coins
5% Chance = 1000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Melon-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>During breaks, Melon-pult loves to split its melon arm into two, nibbling away to cool off. "Want a taste?" it asks the zombies cheerfully, while the plants around, sweltering in the heat, can only drool enviously.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches melons at zombies to deal damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds</color>

plants.name: Imitator
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>'I remember the Zombie Wars back in '76', says Imitater in a raspy, old-man's voice, 'Back then, we didn't have all these fancy peashooters and jalapenos. All we had was guts. Guts and a spoon.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Imitator can make copies of your plants!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Plant Imitator on a plant or fusion to receive a free seed packet of that plant, cannot imitate pots, pads, pumpkins or drones.</color>

plants.name: Neko Squash
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>The grace of a cat and the clumsiness of a squash make a unique kind of beauty, Cat-Squash murmurs. Once I master both, I'll stir things up on this lawn. She adjusts her hat and locks eyes on an unsuspecting zombie nearby.</color>
plants.info:
<size=33>Super Nyanko, Neko Squash!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops itself if she doesn't hit anything. For each zombie crushed, a Squash seed packet is dropped, up to a maximum of 3. Crushing 3 or more zombies will drop an additional Spicy Squash seed packet.</color>

plants.name: Swordmaster Starfruit</size>
plants.introduce: <size=31><color=black>"I have fought across 3,000 miles of battlefield, my blade halting millions in their tracks." The Swordmaster Starfruit, a lover of fine drinks and poetry, takes great pride in his impeccable cosplay skills. With a sly smile, he adds, "My sword never bleeds, for it is merely a decoration."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=31>A guest from afar, I think you will want to become friends.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200*5+30*20/6 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack unleashes 5 swords that pierce infinitely, dealing 200 damage each. Additionally, it inflicts 600 damage to all zombies within the surrounding grid, repeating this 20 times.</color></size>

plants.name: Zombie Giftbox
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Introducing the Zombie Giftbox—the zombies' entry point into the world of finance. As a high-risk financial product, it comes equipped with a reminder: "Investing carries inherent risks; proceed with caution. Sponsored by Dr. Yan Wang." This vital information is cleverly tucked inside the box lid.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Earn 100 Sun, but spawns a Gold-box Zombie.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spawns a Golden Mystery-box Zombie.</color></size>

plants.name: Giant-nut Spawn
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>阳光父子坚果说付我500阳光，让我帮他个忙，所以我来了。能难到哪里去呢？总不可能是冲进僵尸堆里吧？</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>碾压僵尸。

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color></size>

plants.name: Cattail Girl
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Cats are usually afraid of water, but I'm a magical cat girl, so I'm not afraid." she said enthusiastically, and the other cats looked at her with admiration. Actually, she absolutely loves water, and she said this to make herself stand out.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Cattail Girl will automatically attack all zombies that appear on the map.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Barley
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Barley calls itself a generalist, but other plants think of it as just a bit player — "After all, other plants always do the work, don't they?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Barley can transform into any basic, fused, or ultimate plant.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Transforms into a random plant every 30 seconds.</color></size>

plants.name: Endoflame
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>It is said that small flowers like her would never dream of producing Sun — the Endoflame was originally going to apply for the position of Sunflower, but she realized that her light would only shine when she is being destroyed. Everyone says that the flame at the top of her head is the brightest, but she knows that her fiery eyes of determination is the source of her strength.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>The Endoflame can absorb projectiles and produce Sun.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each projectile reduces toughness by 50 and produce 25 Sun. Produces a Fertilizer upon death.</color></size>

plants.name: Giant-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I am invincible on the battlefield, and my partners can't take their eyes off my majestic figure!" the Giant-nut boasted. "One year after getting kicked out of the Wall-nut Tumbler Club, I finally found a job that truly suits me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Giant-nut will roll forward and knock down any zombies it encounters.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Rolls down the lane, killing all the zombies on its path.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Wall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Plant Giftbox
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>No one quite understands why the Plant Giftbox fights alongside the plants against the zombies. He doesn't look like a plant at all, yet he seems to know every plant's abilities inside and out. "Actually, I'm just a college student who loves video games," he admits with a grin. "The professor mentioned extra credit, so here I am."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>The Plant Giftbox can be planted to produce random plants or fusions.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When placed on soil or on a Lily Pad, produces a random plant. Placing it on top of an eligible plant can produce a random fusion.</color></size>

plants.name: Empress-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Empress-shroom holds great affection for her zombie subordinates. "They contributed significantly to my rise as an Empress," she expressed. Unfortunately, these powerful zombies instill fear in other plants, something Empress-shroom is completely unaware of.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Summons zombies that will fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Randomly selects 1 of the following zombies to summon:
Rugby-nut Zombie | Cherryshooter Newspaper Zombie | Zomboni | Scholar Zombie</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypno-shroom + Hypno-shroom</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Summon Interval → 10 Seconds | Enchantress-shroom Sub-species Unlocked
2. Can now summon Ultimate Zombies</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Cherrybomber
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm not sure why the Gatling Pea has so many fans. My brother and I can fire four bullets too," Gatling Cherrybomber remarked enviously. However, the truth is that everyone appreciates Gatling Pea for his kindness and outstanding culinary talents.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Cherrybomber is the strongest damage-dealer on land.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Gatling Cherry + Explod-o-shooter</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Cherry bomb bullets now deal 3x more DMG
2. Attack Interval → 1 Second</color></size>

plants.name: Squashed Infernowood
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Squashed Infernowood has a high opinion of himself, but other plants regard him with disdain, particularly those in the pea family. "He's too picky! He possesses such strong power, yet it only benefits cherries," they say. This infuriates Squashed Infernowood. "I'm just allergic to peas…"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Spawns a Spicy Squash for every 20 cherries that pass through.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Cherry bomb bullets that pass through it become bouncing spicy squashes that explode after every bounce. After 20 of such bullets have passed, spawn a Spicy Squash in front.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Infernowood + Spicy Squash</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Bullets required for Spicy Squash → 10
2. Now spawns two Spicy Squash</color></size>

plants.name: Cherrizilla
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Cherrizilla proudly says, "Many envy my dinosaur-like hairstyle." As a public figure, he's mindful of his image: "Spitting cherries and eating zombies is gross, but it's my duty."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Cherrizilla is the ultimate defensive plant on land.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Chomping zombies restores 1000 Toughness, deal a 1000 damage, and spits out exploding cherries. Zombies with HP < 2000 will be insta-killed and restore full Toughness to Cherrizilla. Repels vehicles back, receiving at most 1/3 of its maximum Toughness. Loses 10% of max HP if current HP exceeds max.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Chewzilla + Cherry Chomper</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Can now kill zombies with less health than itself
2. 200% healing bonus and zombie damage is capped at 500</color></size>

plants.name: Doominator-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Would Death employ a fashionista? Doominator-shroom had no idea, but after noticing that he couldn't consistently frighten zombies, he turned to Hypno-shroom for some costume suggestions. Although people might not favor Death, how would they react if he wore sparkling ice wings?</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Doominator-shroom deals immense damage, simultaneously charming and slowing down zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/0.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a chance to charm zombies with HP < 50%, creating an explosion in the grid where the charmed zombie is located with thrice the normal damage.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Doomberg-shroom + Frostveil-shroom</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Fumes now deal 3x more DMG
2. Increased Freezing speed by 3 times</color></size>

plants.name: Twin Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Twin Solar-nut, a photosynthesis master, revolutionized light energy-mass conversion, minimizing energy loss through recycling. He humbly credits the pioneers: "I'm just standing on the shoulders of giants."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Twin Solar-nut produces Sun every time it is injured.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Regardless of the damage type, each attack on it will only reduce 50 Toughness. Produces 15 Sun after every hit. Clicking on it consumes 500 Sun, causes a Giant-nut to come rolling down, and restores 1500 Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Sunflower + Wall-nut) + Wall-nut</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Restore full Toughness instead
2. Toughness reduced per hit → 10</color></size>

plants.name: Spikesidian
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>After being baptized by fire and ice, Spikesidian became as hard as steel, but its temperament also became erratic. This change is likely due to the steel that condensed in its mouth, making it reluctant to speak.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikesidian can deal immense damage while also tanking multiple tires.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100*2/1 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Spikecicle + Spikinferno</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Damage multiplied by 5
2. Gains 95% DMG Reduction</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Doom
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>"Gatling Doom is dangerous and should not be approached. It is a forbidden force in the world." Despite the frightening tales circulating among the plants, Gatling Doom is not as it seems. In fact, it is one of the friendliest plants. However, the zombies turned to ashes would disagree.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Destruction incarnate. Fires rounds of destruction unlucky enough to face its wrath.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Fires a bullet of doom that deals 1800 damage once every 4 round of bullets. Each bullet will splash damage over a large area.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Gatling Pea + Doom-shroom</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. No more rest between every attack
2. Can now fire bullets of doom every round</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Icicle-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>The little puff-shrooms who once shouted, "We are going to join the army!" have matured into veterans with resolute eyes. Wherever and whenever, the Gatling Icicle-shroom Company is committed to ensuring that the mission is accomplished.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Can be stacked three times to shoot 12 icicles at once!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4*3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit adds 5 Cryo Points. Icicles deal 4 times more damage to frozen enemies. Each icicle can pierce 3 times.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Gatling Snow (In Order)</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Increased icicles' penetration to 10 times
2. Increased damage to Frozen zombies by 10x</color></size>

plants.name: Magnetar
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>No one knows where Magnetar is from, but one thing's for sure: He was not responsible for the dinosaurs. Not at all!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Why the heck is there a meteor on my lawn!?

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>25*5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>+20 Damage per Lumos Level.</color>
<color=#495057>Magnetic System: </color><color=#8B0000>+5% Damage per Magnetic Plant.
<color=#6A0C9D>Both systems can increase the damage of the stars by upto 300, maximum.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a meteor every 20 seconds, dealing 1800 damage upon impact. Splits into multiple stars that home in on zombies and deal 100 damage each.</color></color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Stardrop + Magnethorn</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Attack Interval → 0.5 Seconds
2. Base damage is doubled and limiter (120) is removed</color></size>

plants.name: Oblivion-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>"Nuclear deterrence is beneficial. Someday, the zombies will stop their assaults out of fear of my formidable self-detonation," Oblivion-shroom asserted with confidence. Yet, it was evident that Oblivion-shroom failed to understand that zombies wouldn't initiate a Cold War just because they were hit with cold air.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Sprays deadly fumes all around, bringing ultimate destruction. Beware!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>(100+100*8)*4/1.9 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Damage Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5*5</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>5*3</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Doomberg-shroom + Snowgloom-shroom</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Damage on death → 1,000,000
2. Now absorbs explosion damage. When 10,000 damage is absorbed, a Doom-shroom explosion is released</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>"Magnet-shroom's power remains unmatched," said Laser Pumpkin. "After all, composite armor, electromagnetic catapults, and plasma guns came nearly a century after aircraft carriers." Other plants envied Laser Pumpkin's high-tech gear, but only Magnet-shroom knew his power came from a Magnetar meteorite.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Spawns laser drones that home in on enemies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Always has a Laser Drone wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Laser Drone on top of a 3x3 grid regularly.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Bloverthorn Pumpkin + Magblover</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Wingmen Amount → 3
2. Inherits Joker Pumpkin's effects when in the same Magnetic System | Blast Pumpkin Sub-species Unlocked</color></size>

plants.name: Laser Drones
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>感谢究极杨桃，现在我们有一整套新装备了！看看这些新奇玩意，复合装甲，电磁高速螺旋桨，还有等离子机炮......等等！不！我最喜欢的花瓶！</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>激光无人机可以发射激光穿透攻击。

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200/1.5 Seconds (作为植物) 200/1 Seconds(作为僚机)</color></size>

plants.name: Obsidian-nut
plants.introduce: <size=29><color=black>Rather than seeking his best friend's protection, this plant prefers to protect him. With a hard, gem-like body and steadfast gaze, he's forged by the Obsidian-nut's soul, enduring trials of ice and fire. Though his body may wear down one day, he's determined to keep other plants safe.</color></size></size>
plants.info:
<size=29>The Obsidian-nut has four times the defense of a normal Tall-Nut.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>32000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Restores 1500 HP every 15 seconds. Resists being run over by a car, taking a maximum of 200 damage each time. When one Obsidian-nut receives damage it is shared and divided among all Obsidian-nuts on the lawn.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Frost-nut + Scorch-nut</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
</color><color=#8B0000>1. Recovers 10,000 Toughness when affected by Ice-shrooms. Full Toughness if Jalapeno
2. Damage mitigation for the two plants on its left and right</color></size>

plants.name: Wither-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>After overcoming past struggles, Wither-pult now aims for a calm life. "All I want now is to watch classic movies and live in peace."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Capable of rapid, spread-fire volleys of projectiles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>42% chance of rapid-firing. Has an equal chance to spread-fire in a number equal to the number of zombies in its lane. Projectiles split into garlic, corn, and melon upon impact.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Salad-pult + Garlic-pult</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
<color=#8B0000>1. Spread-fire is now guaranteed
2. Melon Pot's traits are now inherited</color>

plants.name: Cob-livion Cannon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Clad in icy armor and dark as a warning, each shot from Cob-livion Cannon brings destruction. Zombies hit by it need not prepare—nothing will remain after the flash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possesses earth-shattering power.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Main Blast - 1800 in a 3x3 area. Additional 1800 + 30% of Zombies' max HP across the entire screen. Side gun: 360*2/1.5 Seconds with Slow </color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cryo Cannon + Cryodoom-shroom</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
<color=#8B0000>1. Main Blast damage is multiplied by 4
2. Reload Time → 12 Seconds</color>

plants.name: Midas Umbrella
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>From its appearance, you can tell that Midas Umbrella has a knack for business. "That's right, my hat of emerald was a trade item I exchanged with someone from a place full of blocks..."</color>
plants.info:
<size=30>A combination of Alchemist Umbrella and Umbrella Kale.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the traits of both its materials. Also allows projectiles to hit zombies in the two rows below. Its Coffee Bean ultimate can instantly kill zombies below 50% health.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Alchemist Umbrella + Umbrella Kale</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
<color=#8B0000>1. Projectiles will continuously bounce along other Midas Umbrella until the last one. Each bounce increases projectile damage by 1.8x.
2. Activates ultimate automatically if zombies are near. 7.5 seconds cooldown | Aegis Umbrella Sub-species Unlocked</color>

plants.name: Enchantress-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=31><color=black>The subjects of the Empress-shroom are captivated by the Enchantress-shroom’s mysterious power. She’s not just my advisor; she's the force that keeps our kingdom thriving. Her magic isn't just powerful—it's explosive, the Empress-shroom declared. In truth, the Enchantress-shroom simply delights in blowing up any unruly dissenters who dare resist her charm.</color>
plants.info:
<size=31>Summons Gatling Cherry Newspaper zombies to fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>The same as Empress-shroom, but only summons Gatling Cherry Newspaper zombies. Benefits from Empress-shroom buffs and immediately summons when an Empress-shroom dies in a 3*3 radius, Empress-shroom too when a nearby Enchantress-shroom dies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Empress-shroom + Cherry Bomb</color>

plants.name: Ashen Threepeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The flames consume his broken body, each breath a torment, yet the Ashen Threepeater stands tall. He believes the fire within will achieve eternal glory in one final, grand explosion.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ashen Threepeater awaits his rebirth.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Loses attack capabilities after being thoroughly burnt.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Scorched Threepeater + Jalapeno</color>

plants.name: Phoenix Threepeater
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>No one knows if fire truly brings rebirth to plants—it’s just a legend. Those who chased it turned to ash, until he became the new legend. I don’t know how many times I must endure the flames to succeed, but for them, I have to.</color>
plants.info:
<size=32>From fire reborn!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160x3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Torches the whole lawn on entry, projectiles inflict Enflamed debuff, pierce three times with damage doubled after passing Squashed Infernowood.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ashen Threepeater + Jalapeno</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
<color=#8B0000>1. Enflamed damage multiplier → 150%, and ignited peas can now inflict the debuff
2. Bullets can now pierce infinitely</color>

plants.name: Gravitron
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The Gravitron has mastered electromagnetism with Magnetar. "It's not rocket science—left-hand force, right-hand electricity", it boasted. "And don’t forget the moving magnet—trust the smartest plant around!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gravitron pulls stars, accelerates them and launches at zombies at max force.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Storage Limit - 60, Acceleration Time - 1.5 Seconds, Damage - thrice</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Magnetar + Blover</color>

plants.name: Garlizilla
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Dressed in plain clothes with a gaudy gold tooth, one word from him sends others fleeing. 'Garlick me, I've had enough of the spotlight. Standing out doesn't suit me anymore—I just want a quiet, simple life.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cousin to the ultimate defensive plant on land.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>A Cherrizilla variant that no longer heals from cherry explosions, inherits garlic properties, and shoots projectiles that poison zombies. Can be switched to Cherrizilla with a Cherry Bomb and vice versa with a Garlic. Unlocked alongside Cherrizilla.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cherrizilla + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Blast Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Cherry? Pumpkin? Or a hybrid born of fusion? The Blast Pumpkin doesn’t bother with such details. For him, Halloween is all about handing out juicy cherries to the good kids and cherry bombs to the naughty ones—nothing else matters. </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blast-proof pumpkin.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>No longer spawns hover drones, immune to cherry explosions and heals from them. Every 30 seconds spawns a self-destructing drone that seeks out zombies and explodes like a Cherry Bomb.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Laser Pumpkin + Cherry Bomb</color>

plants.name: Aegis Umbrella
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Many question the relationship between Midas Umbrella and Aegis Umbrella. 'We’re brothers!' Aegis confidently declares, thumping its canopy. 'My dear elder brother is just going through a rough patch emotionally.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Reflects projectiles from zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>A variant of the Midas Umbrella. You can switch between the two with Melon-pults and Cabbage-pults. Aegis loses the ability to buff lobbed projectiles but now gains a 90% Damage Reduction and can reflect zombie projectiles.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Midas Umbrella + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Charmatron-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black></color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Charisma maxima.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles have a 1-tile splash radius with no falloff, cannot be consumed by zombies. Feeding it metal objects grants 1 charge level for 30 seconds, up to 2 charges. At 1 charge level, it fires 2 shots per attack and 2 charge level, 4 shots. Each plant in the same Magnetic System provides a 5% damage boost to its shots.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Charm-shroom + Charm Magnet</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Buffs:
<color=#8B0000>1.Charm HP threshold increased from 50% to 100%
2. Now always in a fully-charged state | Attack Interval → 1 Second</color>

plants.name: Pea Sunflower
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Actually, the Sunflower behind me is my sister," Peashooter explained to everyone. "We've been inseparable since birth. She loves producing Sun, and I destroy zombies on her behalf." But everyone knows the truth: the cheerful Pea brother is a total siscon. After all, every zombie that gets near his sister mysteriously ends up vaporized by sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Sunflower can fire Sun Bullets which produce Sun.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Bullets drop 5 Sun when hitting zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Sunflower</color></size>

plants.name: Cherryshooter
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"You think I have red-hot anger issues? Me? Bah! You're red and hot! Your whole family is red!" Cherryshooter despised being teased about the color of his head. But the jokes didn't last long. It was just a happy incident. After eating special cherries, Peashooter found himself turning red and hot, and surprisingly, he could shoot cherries.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter fires powerful cherries.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Bomb
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"So… it's obvious… we are Pretty Cure, aren't we?" The two Sunflower sisters tried to suppress their excitement. "The world needs us to save it!" Their passion bubbled over as they shouted together, "Light! Illuminate this land!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Bomb can produce Sun after killing zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 25 Sun for each zombie killed in the explosion.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry-nut
plants.introduce: <size=35><color=black>"I heard some zombies grumbling about their inability to eat cherries. Well, here I am!" The cheerful Cherry Nut shook the leaves atop his head, boasting about his pure cherry flavor. "But first, you have to promise me something: when you have cherries, share a bit with me. In fact, just give me everything you've got! I was born for this!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=35>Cherry-nut can absorb explosion damage and restore toughness.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbs Cherry explosion damage to restore toughness. (From Ally: 25, From Enemy: 200)</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cherry Bomb + Wall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"No... don't call me ugly, or else... wait... I'll spray you." Pea-nut has always struggled with his "unique" appearance. But he firmly believes that what's inside a plant matters more than how it looks. Seeking guidance, he humbly asked senior Bowling Nut for advice and eventually mastered the technique of rolling nuts like bowling balls.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-nut fire mini-nuts that can penetrate zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Wall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Explod-o-shooter
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Meet Explod-o-shooter, the ultimate plant killer. He's more irritable than ever—who would've thought the warm and friendly Cherryshooter would swallow another special cherry? Don't push your luck with him. That cherry stuck in his throat might just be his next shot—his face is already turning red!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>The cherries fired by Explod-o-shooter will cause area explosion damage. He's also immune to cherry explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Cherry Bomb + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Solar-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Solar-nut always sees himself as an angel, blissfully unaware that the other plants often talk behind his back. "You know, if he adds a few black lines, he'd look exactly like a bee!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar-nut produce Sun while protecting your plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Wall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Pea Mine
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Pea Mine may not have eyes, but he has his own special way of sensing zombies. "I feel it…" he murmured, "The zombies are getting closer… closer… closer…" Pea Mine's heartbeat quickened, and so did his firing speed. Faster, faster… until, with a "bang," Pea Mine exploded into a burst of potato-flavored fireworks.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea Mine can attack before unearthing.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks faster as zombies get closer. Upon exploding, releases 36 projectiles in all directions.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Potato Mine</color></size>

plants.name: Cherrypeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Cherrypeater lives by the motto "good things come in pairs." Whether it's fighting zombies or handing out presents, he does it all in twos. "But come on," Repeater teased, "those cherries of yours aren't even close to ripe."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherrypeater can fire two cherries at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Repeater + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Mine
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Stop at red lights, slow down at yellow lights, and obey traffic rules!" Solar Mine frequently warns zombies. But to the zombies, all they see is the disgusting green hue before them. He clutches his green leaves and pouts, wishing for more sunshine. "After all, sunshine is what fuels us all!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Mine produces Sun until and after its explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Potato Mine</color></size>

plants.name: Mine-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Once seen as small and weak, Mine-nut now stood tall and strong, boasting a pair of big eyes and firm flesh. Yet beneath that sturdy exterior, he felt fragile and feared shrinking back to his former size. The zombies quipped, "If you take another bite, you'll explode!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mine-nut can explode while being eaten and once when broken.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500 / Explosion, 1800 / Death</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Potato Mine</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-shooter
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Chomper has always envied Chomp-shooter's ability to spit out zombie remains, and he's tried to learn the trick more than once. Little did he know, though, that the secret wasn't a special skill—it was just that Chomp-shooter's mouth was slightly deformed, causing bits of zombie to leak out while chewing.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Chomp-shooter can fire parts after biting.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Spits out rolling zombie parts after biting that deals 80 damage.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-nut
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>As a young plant, Chomp-nut was notoriously picky about food, never swallowing zombies in one bite, which frustrated its parents. After much persuasion, Chomp-nut finally learned to consume zombies whole, just like its predecessors. "I'm not picky! I just want to imitate how zombies eat. I should try something new, right? It's definitely not because I don't have a neck!" Chomp-nut said while chewing on a zombie.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Chomp-nut can restore toughness after eating zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Chewzilla
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Chewzilla savors every meal, despite his smaller mouth. "Big mouths are sloppy and don't hit the gym; they fall apart on the front line," he scoffs. "I only eat the essence of zombie meat and spit out the rest," he grins, though his backyard is filling up with leftovers.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Chewzilla can both be a bulwark and fierce attacker.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Eating zombies restores 200 Toughness and deals 200 Damage while spitting out rolling zombie parts that inflict 80 Damage and pierce infinitely. Zombies with HP < 500 and no armor are instantly killed, restoring 400 Toughness and spitting out rolling zombie parts.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Wall-nut + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Solar Chomper
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Everyone was curious about how Solar Chomper transformed the zombies it devoured into sunlight, but it always hesitated to share its secret. One day, Sunflower discovered that her chlorophyll content had significantly diminished, revealing the truth: it wasn't actually turning zombies into sunlight.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Solar Chomper can produce Sun after swallowing zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces 100 Sun after swallowing zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Chomp-mine
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Delicious and enticing, Potato Mines taste just like self-heating mashed potatoes, earning rave reviews from zombies. Among them, fries take the top spot in popularity. As zombies flock to the tantalizing aroma of French fries, they have no idea they're also indulging in tasty potato chips. "Just wait and see," Chomp-mine said with a mouthful, "Their nutrients will soon become new mines."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>After swallowing a zombie, the Chomp-mine will grow Potato Mines in front.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Plants a Potato Mine in front of it upon swallowing a zombie.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Potato Mine + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Cherry Chomper
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Ever since her drink with Cherry Bomb, Chomper has been constantly "buzzing." She turned into an absolute menace every meal. The sound of chewing transformed into explosive pops as plates and bowls flew everywhere, leaving everyone unwilling to dine with her. After a show of hands, Cherry Chomper ended up eating in the yard… at least she no longer has to buy new tableware.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a cherry explosion upon eating a zombie.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill + 1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Creates a Cherry explosion in a 3x3 grid when biting.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cherry Bomb + Chomper</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Cherry
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Gatling Cherry's barrel was always red hot. He assured everyone that it was preheated to ensure faster firing. Everyone bought the story—until they caught him eating special cherries without even removing the barrel.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherryshooter's final form!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Gatling Pea + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Don't let my size fool you; even a small body can contain a lot of energy," Pea-shroom cautions those who underestimate him. "We all began as tiny mushrooms, making progress a little at a time. With dedication to a sunny breakfast, you can become just like me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Pea-shroom shoot further than Puff-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Peashooter (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Repeat-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Who am I? The double-shot holds the answer!" exclaims the little Repeat-shroom, proudly flaunting the twin leaves atop its head. With double the firing rate and double the cheer, these spirited beings thrive in groups, eagerly pouring their firepower onto the battlefield, showcasing that size doesn't define their strength.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeat-shroom can fire two small peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Peashooter * 2</color></size>

plants.name: Buckshooter
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I embody the spirit of my ancestors; I will not fall here!" Buckshooter asserted confidently to anyone who crossed his path. When it was pointed out that his helmet resembled one stolen from the Buckethead Zombie, he countered, "Then let us invoke their will and ride the winds and waves once more!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buckshooter has the ability to crack armor.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back on contact. Deals immense damage to Iron Zombies, and break iron doors.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Bucket</color></size>

plants.name: Nut-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Nut or mushroom? Why worry about labels? Nut-shroom isn't about to tell you it's actually a matsutake in disguise anyway.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Nut-shroom can be your stalwart defender despite its size.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Wall-nut (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Hypno-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"As a kid, I believed zombies were nothing more than fairy tale monsters," Mini Hypno-shroom said softly. "Now, don't get it twisted—I'm just restoring them to the fairy tale form they were always supposed to have."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shrinks a zombie and makes it fight for you!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Makes a zombie smaller (cuts Health in half) and fight for you.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Hypno-shroom (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Perfume-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>The colorful Perfume-shroom makes a grand debut! With a blast of perfume, it can turn zombies around in an instant. Some claim it's a secret technique passed down by the mushroom family, while others believe it's a cutting-edge military weapon. Perfume-shroom just smiles and says, "It's all thanks to Hypno-shroom helping me rinse my mouth everyday."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Perfume-shroom spray fumes that can charm zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Chance to charm zombies with <50% Health. Hypnotizes the zombie that eats it.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Hypno-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Trippy-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Scaredy-shroom has always been afraid of zombies. In order to reduce her fear, Hypno-shroom tells her a bedtime story every day: "Actually, there are good people among zombies." Over time, Scaredy-shroom was finally brainwashed. Now she can use spores to brainwash zombies. Of course, she is still very afraid.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>Trippy-shroom can fire spores in 7 colors.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Randomly fires 1 of 7 types of spores. When a zombie is hit by all 7 types of spores, it will be charmed. Each time it is hit by a type of spore, the charm probability of the Perfume-shroom will increase.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypno-shroom + Scaredy-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Gutsy-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Courage fills me, no fear remains~ Whether it's spring, fall, winter, or summer~" Gutsy-shroom no longer shrinks in the face of zombies. "I used to tremble, but Senior Fume-shroom told me, 'If a zombie gets near, spray your spores. Hiding won't solve anything.'"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gutsy-shroom is ready to take on the zombies, near or far!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When zombies get close by 3 tiles, they will spray piercing fumes instead.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Scaredy-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Charm-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Charm-shroom speaks with a soft smile, "Each spore carries my love, and when they bloom, it's like a spring breeze caressing the air." She even twisted her head into a heart to express her feelings. Her eyes shine with sincerity, hoping that maybe, just maybe, the zombies will understand her love.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Charm-shroom can fire explosive Charm spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80 / 1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>40 splash damage in a 1x1.5 grid. Has a chance to charm zombies with < 50% HP.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Scaredy-shroom + Hypno-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Tall-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"The taller you are, the more powerful you become." Tall-nut firmly believed in this, which is why he always stayed on the front line. Other plants would urge him to take it easy, but he'd just smile and say, "It's fine, I'm tall. As long as you fight quickly, the zombies won't have time to eat all of me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tall-nuts are heavy-duty wall plants that can't be vaulted or jumped over.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color></size>

plants.name: Rugby-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Rugby-nut looked fierce, causing some small plants that didn't know the truth to feel scared by his appearance. However, the plants that understood Rugby-nut knew that beneath his serious exterior lay a strong determination to protect his companions. The stolen helmet undoubtedly boosted his confidence.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Rugby-nut is able to hold a huge amount of damage.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can be fed metal objects to restore 500 HP.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Tall-nut + Rugby Helmet</color></size>

plants.name: Buck-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Plants hold conflicting feelings about Buck-nut. As an exemplary soldier, he executes orders with unwavering precision, yet his cold demeanor leaves much to be desired. The rust at the corners of his mouth hints at a storied past. In the quiet moments, however, Buck-nut wrestles with an unspoken worry: "How do I prevent rust in a humid garden?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Blocks the zombies' advance with a wall of iron.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can be fed metal objects to restore 500 HP. This also applies to other Metallic Plants.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Bucket</color></size>

plants.name: Repeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Unlike his bright and cheerful brother, Repeater leads a carefree life—until it's time to fight. He secretly mastered the art of double shooting but kept it hidden from Peashooter. "I just want him to live happily, without ever needing to learn these battle skills."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Repeater fires two peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Peashooter</color></size>

plants.name: Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Sun-shroom hates sun. He hates it so much that when it builds up in his system, he spits it out as fast as he can. He just won't abide it. To him, sun is crass.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sun-shrooms give small sun at first and normal sun later.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 (25) / 25 Seconds
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Sunflower</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Gatling Pea, the big brother of the Pea family, stands tall with his gun barrel, the very foundation of everyone's safety. His back is like a monument on the battlefield, admired by all. Yet, he smiles modestly, knowing that his daily life is actually managed by his younger brother, Peashooter. "I can't live without him," he admits quietly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Pea shoots four peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Split Pea + Peashooter</color></size>

plants.name: Twin Sunflower
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The Twin Sunflower are known as sisters, always working behind the scenes rather than on the battlefield's front lines. Their role is to support everyone from the rear, but make no mistake—you must protect them. If they're harmed, many plants will quietly shed tears.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Twin Sunflowers give twice as much sun as a normal sunflower.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25*2/20 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Sunflower</color></size>

plants.name: Snow Pea
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The cold-blooded Snow Pea rarely displays his emotions to other plants. Some say his heart is even colder than the frozen peas he fires. Snow Pea doesn't want to come off that way, but every time he opens his mouth, the bullets he launches plunge the atmosphere around him to freezing temperatures.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snow Peas shoot frozen peas that damage and slow the enemy.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each bullet will add 10 Cryo Points.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Peashooter + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Icicle-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>The Icicle-shrooms didn't set out to master refrigeration technology. During a hiking trip, they forgot their quilts and spent an entire night frozen atop a mountain, frost forming on their heads. Later, Snow Pea, captivated by their frosty appearance, gifted them some icicles to complement their new look.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>Icicle-shroom fires icicles that slow down enemies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Adds 5 Cryo Points for every icicle hit. Pierce 3 times. Each icicle will deal 4 times more damage to a frozen zombie.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Snow Pea (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Ice-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Smaller in size, same big abilities!" Mini Ice-shroom's signature poker face never cracks as he delivers his jokes, and that might just be why zombies freeze on the spot.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Ice-shroom can temporarily freeze zombies they come into contact with.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freezes zombies that eat it in place.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Ice-shroom (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Frost-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Frost-shroom stands out among the Fume-shrooms. His study abroad in the freezing Alaskan wilderness made him even cooler—literally. Though he only studied hair design for a few years, he's pretty proud of it.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost-shroom's fumes can pass through and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000> Will add 5 Cryo Points after each attack.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Shivery-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Shivery-shroom believes he stands apart from other scaredy-shrooms. Unlike them, he never shrinks in fear and joins in all activities without hesitation. However, that's only because when he gets scared, the air around him plummets in temperature, leaving everyone too afraid to startle him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shivery-shroom fires freezing spores.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>10 Cryo Points per attack.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Freeze nearby zombies when they get near.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Scaredy-shroom + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Frost-nut
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Frost-nut raised its icy spikes high, ready to confront the zombies. Others remarked on how "cold" and "silent" he seemed. Yet, his expression remained unchanged, resolute in his defense against the undead. The truth was his face had simply frozen in place.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Frost-nut are heavy barrier plants. They slow down zombies that bite them.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that bite it are slowed down and accumulate 10 Cryo Points.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When affected by the Ice-shroom, heals 1000 Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ice-shroom + Tall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Cryodoom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I will freeze the world, and silence will reign. The extreme cold will disrupt your body's temperature system, so it won't be very painful," Cryodoom-shroom proclaims. He seldom appears in battle, but when he does, a blizzard follows in his wake. With a flash of white light, even time seems to freeze.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cryodoom-shroom can destroy zombies in the entire screen and freeze time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000> Freezes the level – no new zombies will appear within 10 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ice-shroom + Doom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Frostveil-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>A frosty beauty? An untouchable flower? Frostveil-shroom couldn't care less. She quietly took care of the frosty ornament on her head, always ready to hand her Frost-nut headgear to the zombies at any time. "They'll appreciate the chill vibe," she remarks coolly.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>When a zombie eats a Frostveil-shroom, it will transform into a Frost-nut Zombie that will fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon contact turns a zombie into an Frost-nut Zombie that will fight for you. Also freezes the full field.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypno-shroom + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Frenzy-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>While some plants instinctively bury their heads when nervous, Frenzy-shroom thrives on excitement. His adrenaline spikes, causing his spores to fire at an increasing rate. It's wise to avoid provoking him again, or he might explode from all that pent-up energy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>Frenzy-shroom's attack speed increases as it attacks.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20 / 1.5 Seconds (0.5 Peak)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will shorten the attack interval by 0.1 seconds, max 0.5 seconds. Resets when zombies get near. Will explode when zombies get near while peak attack speed is reached.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Scaredy-shroom + Doom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Soot-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Soot-shroom, the misanthropic workaholic, can't stand the sight of zombies—too much of a distraction. He's got a small stash of bullets, but they're more than lethal enough. "Don't bother me unless it's urgent. If you want them dead, just shoot them yourself." Still, his sharp efficiency keeps everyone looking up to him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Soot-shroom can destroy most zombies in front of it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800/60 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Click manually to attack all zombies in a row.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Doom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Mini Doom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Mini Doom-shroom may be small, but his temper is explosive. Disagree with him, and he might blow up—no eye contact needed. It's best to admire him from afar—just don't get too close, or things might get messy.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mini Doom-shroom will explode when it comes into contact with a zombie.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Will explode when zombies get close.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Doom-shroom (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Curse-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>The plants have always wondered why zombies can't be killed for good. Recently, Curse-shroom uncovered the mystery: "I didn't really do much," it said modestly. "I just kindly helped the zombies activate their backup hidden power source. Doesn't that red zombie look especially harmless? I did warn them, though."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will get hypnotized, and explode after death.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that eat the Curse-shroom will be charmed to fight for you. The cursed zombie will explode upon its death, dealing massive damage.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypno-shroom + Doom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Doomberg-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Frost has wrapped around his body, stripping away the innocence of his youth. His eyes, colder and deadlier than any gun's barrel, now only show disdain for his enemies. He's become the reaper, the end of the line. Anyone caught in his frosty sights would do well to leave one less meal prepared at home.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Doomberg-shroom can fire explosive ice cones.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Add 10 Cryo Points to zombies each hit. Deals 4 times the damage to frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Pierces 3 enemies. Splashes 10 damage within range of enemy contact.
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Ice-shroom + Doom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Squash-spreader
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"He has three heads, and his base isn't even a leaf! He looks nothing like a regular pea!" Many plants cower at the sight of Squash-spreader's peculiar appearance. Yet, Squash-spreader remains unfazed. He thrives in his vibrant life, battling zombies, reading voraciously, playing chess, and winning every pool skipping contest.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash-spreader can fire small bouncing squashes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*3/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time a mini-squash hits the ground, it inflicts 40 points of damage to nearby zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Squash + Threepeater</color></size>

plants.name: Spicy Kelp
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Passion is like fire," and Spicy Kelp knows this saying all too well. No amount of water can quench their fervent flames! Too bad, the nearby zombies can only feel the heat of the "grilling". Look at them, they have already turned to ashes in this relentless fire!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Kelp will burn the entire row of zombies upon contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill + 1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Tangle Kelp + Jalapeno (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Mangle Kelp
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Mangle Kelp stands out as a true philosopher among plants. It often ponders profound questions like, "Where does the grass come from, and where does it go?" However, its disregard for personal hygiene and unkempt hair make other plants shy away, preferring to keep their distance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Mangle Kelp can drag three zombies into the water.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> Instant Kill*3</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Squash + Tangle Kelp</color></size>

plants.name: Kelp-spreader
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Kelp-spreader basked in the sun, his eyes scanning the horizon. "Many plants are scared of my gaze," he chuckled. "But they'd understand if they had to wear three pairs of sunglasses for protection like I do!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fire kelps that slow down zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*3/1.5 Slows + Stackable with Frozen  </color>
<color=black>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Each kelp will cause additional percentage damage based on the zombie's Tangle Value. The zombie will be insta-killed when the Tangle Value is full.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater + Tangle Kelp</color></size>

plants.name: Infernowood
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>"It's sweltering out here!" Infernowood fumed. Convinced that the intense weather was to blame for its skin, it noted how the flames on its head had also turned a vibrant red. Maybe it was the perfect time to kick off a summer adventure called the "Sledding Tour."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Infernowood can provide an even stronger damage boost to projectiles!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Improve damage depending on the type of projectile. Explodes upon death.
Peas: 80 | Cherries: 120 | Iron Peas: 320 | Sunlight: 400 | Threeway Pea: 60
Deals 40 damage-over-time to splashed zombies every 3 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Torchwood + Jalapeno + Jalapeno</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchwood
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>High temperatures and spiciness always go hand in hand. Scorchwood may not grasp this concept, but his years of working at the barbecue stall have certainly infused him with a distinctive heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Projectiles ignited by the Scorchwood has greatly increased power.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Improve damage depending on the type of projectile. Ignites the lane upon death.
Peas: 60, Cherries: 120, Bucks: 320, Sunlight: 400, Threeway Pea: 45</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Torchwood</color></size>

plants.name: Spicy Squash
