plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm not as impatient as my brother," Spicy Squash stated calmly. "He rushes through everything, but I've learned that true success comes from patience and careful observation. Sometimes, it's best to wait and let the fire simmer."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy Squash can burn a whole row of zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000> 1800 (Single Tile) + 1800 (Lane + Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Squash + Jalapeno</color></size>

plants.name: Torchthree
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Why is Torchthree so rich?" the plants frequently pondered. "Oh, it's no big deal," he shrugged. Torchthree then produced three peas from his hair and added, "I used to work as a magician in a circus."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can turn one pea into three flaming peas.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Splits the peas that pass through into 3 small flaming peas that deal 30 splash damage.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater + Torchwood</color></size>

plants.name: Torch-kelp
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Fire struggles to exist beneath the water, which means I can't use my flames to light the way," Torch-kelp admitted. "But once above the surface, my flames can shine once again."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Ignite kelp shots or drag zombies into the water.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites peas and kelp shots. Ignited kelp shots can add 1 Tangle Value to all zombies in the splash range. Every time 100 shots are lit, a Tangle Kelp will be planted in front.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Tangle Kelp + Torchwood</color></size>

plants.name: Golden Squash
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>火焰窝瓜总是一个接一个从窝炬里跳出来。"炼瓜炉里太热了，把我身体都要烤化了！"几个金色的火焰窝瓜一起喊道。</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>他只是一个金色的窝瓜。

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color></size>

plants.name: Scorched Threepeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Why does Jalapeno always get all the credit?" Scorched Threepeater exclaimed, smoke escaping from his mouth. "If they only realized that fusing with Jalapeno burns your peas." He turned to Torchwood with a serious look. "Trust me, you wouldn't want to munch on charred peas!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Threepeater who can't fuse because he's scorched.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a line of flames that deal 1800 (Cremator) damage in three lanes when planted or fused.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater + Jalapeno</color></size>

plants.name: Squashed Torchwood
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"It's way too hot! Too hot!" Squash yelled, trapped in the flames of Torchwood. "Who put me here? I should be squashing zombies, not being the punchline at a barbecue party!" The heat was overwhelming, and as he reached his breaking point, he ignited, bursting forth from the torch to rejoin the battle against the zombies.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces a Squash in front for each 60 peas that pass through it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every time 60 peas are lit, a Squash will be planted in front.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Squash + Torchwood</color></size>

plants.name: Spikerock
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Spikerock just got back from a trip to Europe. He had a great time, met some wonderful people, really broadened his horizons. He never knew they made museums so big, or put so many paintings in them. That was a big surprise for him.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikerocks pop multiple tires and hurt any zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can puncture tires, but deducts 50 Toughness.</color></size>

plants.name: Torchweed
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm Torchweed, the zombies' passionate barbecue chef! Ignite that little pea, and I'll throw them an unforgettable barbecue party. Rest assured, I'm a professional—I guarantee it will be crispy on the outside and tender on the inside!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Torchweed can ignite small peas and puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignite small peas for increased, and splashed, damage. Every time 100 small peas are lit, a Torchweed will be planted in front.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Spikeweed + Torchwood</color></size>

plants.name: Scorchweed
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Studies reveal that spiciness is actually a type of pain," Scorchweed announced, rattling the red thorns on his head. "I intend to let the unbelieving zombies experience this reality for themselves."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Scorchweed pops tires and enflames zombies that step on them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20, Inflicts the Enflamed Debuff</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Damage taken increases by 50%; zombies with this debuff explode on death, spreading it further.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Spikeweed</color></size>

plants.name: Squashweed
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Huh? Yeah." This catchphrase belongs to Squashweed, who rarely speaks and often leaves others feeling uncertain. After dinner, the topic of thorns always becomes a favorite among the plants. It's said that on an ordinary afternoon, as Squash prepared to crush a nearby zombie, he overlooked the thorns lurking beneath its feet.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will be knocked back every time it attacks.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack will knock back zombies and fire 1 bouncing mini-squash.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Squash + Spikeweed</color></size>

plants.name: Weed-spreader
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"It was nothing but dandruff that I threw out," Spikeweed declared casually. Weed-spreader raised an eyebrow, unconvinced. "Jealous talk, if you ask me," he replied. "You can't fool me with that excuse."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires 3 weeds that deal enhanced damage to vehicles.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>5*3/1.5 Seconds (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Weeds deal 30% max Toughness damage to vehicles.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater + Spikeweed</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"We're off to join the army!" the three little mushrooms shouted with joy. Although their heights didn't meet the requirements and locating small helmets was a struggle, these challenges couldn't hold back the Gatling Pea-shrooms. United as one, they set their sights on becoming the top trio in the army.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can be stacked three times to shoot 12 small peas at once!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Peashooter * 4</color></size>

plants.name: Krakerberus
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Krakerberus possesses a contemplative heart. If you hand him a glass of root beer, be prepared for a discourse on Nietzsche's or Kant's works. Although he has profound musings, sometimes he longs for lighthearted conversations.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Fires kelp that bounce upon contact and slow down water zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*3/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Kelp bounce upon contact, dealing 40 Damage to nearby zombies when they land. Slows down water enemies. Adds 1 Tangle Value upon contact.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Threepeater + Squash + Tangle Kelp</color></size>

plants.name: Cattail
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Woof!" says Cattail. "Woof woof woof! Does this confuse you? Do you expect me to say 'Meow' like a cat because the word 'cat' is in my name and I also look like a cat? That's not how things work around here. I refuse to be pigeonholed."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cattails can attack any lane and shoot down balloon zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Frost Cattail
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a cat... I'm... I'm a super blue cat!" declared Frost Cattail. "Do you have some cold catnip...?" His love for catnip shines through, and he has an undeniable fascination with all things cool.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Frost Cattail can attack any zombie in the lane and slow them down.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds (Slows) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit on a zombie adds 5 Cryo Points. Additionally focuses its attacks on the affected zombie.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ice-shroom + Cattail</color></size>

plants.name: Flame Cattail
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"When I was young, I thought I'd be a regular Cattail," Flame Cattail said, warming her tail with pride. "Turns out, I'm a blazing inferno of awesomeness!" Frost Cattail sighed from the corner, muttering, "Showoff."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flame Cattail can attack zombies in any lane and deal high damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals thrice the damage to Enflamed zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Cattail</color></size>

plants.name: Gloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I've always enjoyed releasing heavy fumes," says Gloom Shroom. "I know a lot of people aren't cool with that. They say it's rude or that it smells bad. All I can say is, would you rather have your brain eaten by zombies?"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gloom-shrooms fire heavy fumes in an area around them.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/1.9 Seconds</color></size>

plants.name: Embergloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Embergloom-shroom's ability to release hot steam has established him as a celebrated pastry baker. His signature spicy pastries are a favorite among many, cherished for their distinct flavors.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases high-damaging ember fumes around it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*4/1.9 Seconds</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts the Enflamed debuff when attacking zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Gloom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Snowgloom-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Dreaming of a career as a physicist, the Snowgloom-shroom dedicates his days to unraveling the complexities of the world, avoiding contact with other plants. "Why do I have multiple strings of ice cones sprouting from my head?" he muses, the latest question occupying his thoughts. He's oddly adamant about calling them "strings."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Releases cold fumes around that can freeze zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/1.9 Seconds (Piercing) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack adds 5 Cryo Points.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ice-shroom + Gloom-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Scorch-nut
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Scorch-nut is a huge fan of the Olympics and passionately insists that Torchwood be chosen as the Olympic torch. Cautious warning to the uninformed though: do not try to eat him. You may find yourself burning up from the spicy heat.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies will get enflamed when bitten.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that are Enflamed will be 50% more vulnerable to all attacks.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When affected by the Jalapeno, heals 1000 Toughness. Zombies that attack it also lose 20 Health per bite.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Tall-nut</color></size>

plants.name: Spikecicle
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>After his return from Alaska, Spikecicle couldn't contain his excitement. Eager to freeze the zombies solid, he relished the thought of "ice" bursting beneath their feet. He made it a point that everyone use the term "ice." His skin still carried the chill from his Arctic adventure, and his eyes shimmered with the brilliance of unmelting snow.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can puncture tires and freeze zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1 Seconds (Slows) </color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Adds 5 Cryo Points per attack.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can puncture tires, insta-killing vehicles.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Ice-shroom + Spikerock</color></size>

plants.name: Spikinferno
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Not long ago, Spikinferno traveled to Mexico and was swept away by the vibrant enthusiasm of the locals, quickly falling in love with tacos. Now, he's pouring all his energy into a taco museum alongside Spikecicle, though Spikecicle doesn't seem to share his enthusiasm.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Enflame zombies that step on it and also puncture vehicles.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>450</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*2/1 Seconds</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies the Enflamed Debuff when attacking zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Jalapeno + Spikerock</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Thorn-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"People often ask about my appearance, so let me clarify: I'm from the Namib Desert," Sea Thorn-shroom said to anyone who inquired. "If you're familiar with geography, you'll know that a desert can be found right next to the ocean!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attack flying zombies and airships, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20 → 20*4 / 1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>120 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Cactus</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Sun-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Sadly, I am a mushroom, not a flower, so I can't be called a sea flower or anything similar," Sea Sun-shroom admitted. "At times, this brings me down, but don't let it bother you. I may not be a sunflower, yet I can still use different physical and chemical reactions in the water to bring you sunshine!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces increasing amounts of Sun as it grows.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15 → 25 → 50 / 15 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>20 Seconds → 40 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Sunflower</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Lamp-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>"I've been a light system at a pirate pool party, worked for an Amazon deep-water salvage company for three months, and even served as night fishing bait while I was sleeping!" Sea Lamp-shroom shared, a mix of anger and pride evident in his voice. "Now, I'm looking for a stable job. Uncle Dave mentioned that the backyard pool needed lighting, but he forgot to mention it was infested with zombies!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Dispels fog and give light, growing in size after a while.

<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level in a 3x3 Grid, 5x5 after growth.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Plantern</color></size>

plants.name: Lumicactus
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"My adventures in the desert have made me remarkably brilliant," Lumicactus boasted, but he never forgot to replenish his lamp oil each day to ensure he continued to shine.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing spikes and lasers, depending on the Lumos level.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds, 20*2/1.5 Seconds (Air)</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs depending on the Lumos Level:
Level 1 = Pierce 3 Times
Level 2 = Infinite Pierce
Level 3 = Laser Air Damage → 60</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Cactus</color></size>

plants.name: Glowver
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>"The silver candle illuminates the cold autumn canvas, while the light silk fan dances gracefully with the fireflies." This is Glowver's beloved poem. His fascination with fireflies began in childhood, and he often enjoys the cool breeze by the water at night, admiring how their fluorescence rises gently from the wind, twinkling before softly falling back into the dark grass. Only zombies would overlook such exquisite beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Dispels fog and increases the Lumos level of Lumos plants present.

<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gives 1 Lumos Level for Lumos plants in the entire field for 30 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Blover</color></size>

plants.name: Starglow
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Stars dance on the water as fishing lights prepare to rise into the sky. The waves carry away the moon while the tide brings forth the stars. As a child, Starglow dreamed of picking the stars, often gazing at their shimmer on the water. Meeting Plantern taught her that one need not envy the brilliant stars above; even the faintest light, like fireflies, has its own warmth and beauty.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Shoots stars that can track zombies if there's light.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*5/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Gets the following buffs: 
Level 1 = Stars can now track zombies in the same row as them.
Level 2 = Stars are fired continuously regardless of whether there are zombies.
Level 3 = Stars track zombies everywhere.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Starfruit</color></size>

plants.name: Thornball
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Thornballs always move in groups, chirping arrogantly and looking down on others. The other plants are curious what such tiny creatures could possibly do, but the Thornballs remain unfazed: "If butterflies can stir up a storm, then of course we're far more powerful."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spits out thorns to attack zombies in the sky. Does not occupy any grid.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2 / 1.5 seconds (Plant), 20*2 / 1 Second (Wingman)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can be planted on top of another plant.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cactus + Blover</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Star
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Though my name resembles that of an animal, it's just a stage name," Sea Star explained. "I'm a magician who can expel spores of various shapes." He harbors a deep dislike for diving zombies, worried they'll uncover the truth: he's simply a sea-shroom with a star-shaped water gun perched on his head.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks twice when fully grown.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*5 → 20*5*2 / 1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Growth Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Starfruit</color></size>

plants.name: Starblover
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Gather the stars around me and give them to those wishing upon a shooting star," Starblover proudly declares, believing it to be a noble mission. However, not everyone appreciates it—especially when the star shower comes flying directly at them.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts stars to rotate around itself and launch them out.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts nearby star projectiles. After 6 seconds, shoots them out as tracking projectiles with twice the speed and damage. Attracts up to 20 stars max.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Blover + Starfruit</color></size>

plants.name: Starthorn
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Starthorn has always been a bit of an oddity. The plants joke, "He's always on the ground but only fights the flying zombies. Why doesn't he go after the ground ones?" Starthorn, ever patient, says nothing, quietly protecting his secret: his poor vision only allows him to see the sky when he lies down.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can only attack zombies in the sky.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Thorny stars track flying zombies across the board.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cactus + Starfruit</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Blow-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Sea Blow-shroom has aspirations as grand as a dragon's. Mastering the ancient art of "Feng Shui" from the East, he is well aware of both lucky and unlucky positions. Understanding that wind and water complement each other, he hopes to keep misfortune at bay, whether soaring in the sky or gliding through the water.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dispels fog and blows back zombies in the water.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels fog and repels water zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Blover</color></size>

plants.name: Jack O' Lantern
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Jack O' Lantern insists that he frequently encounters ghosts, but do they truly exist? Who can say for certain? Perhaps he was simply dragged into another round of Halloween festivities by someone eager for a good scare.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>In a small area, dispels fog and increase the Lumos Level for the Lumos plants inside.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Give 1 Lumos Level in a 3x3 Grid. Restores 150 Toughness per Lumos Level every 15 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Pumpkin</color></size>

plants.name: Thorngourd
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Thorngourd might look like a distant relative of Pumpkin, but its current form comes from a desert adventure with Blover. Strangely enough, it doesn't seem to have visible thorns, yet plants that try to hop into it always get poked, leaving them questioning how it happens.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Counterattacks the zombies that bite it.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Damage attacking enemies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cactus + Pumpkin</color></size>

plants.name: Stargourd
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>People often wonder how many languages Stargourd must know to communicate effortlessly with all the plants. Stargourd smiles and says, "Actually, I only speak Starfruit's language, since he's the only one I work closely with."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Helps Starblover retain more stars.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Increases the storage limit of Starblover to 60.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Starfruit + Pumpkin</color></size>

plants.name: Split Pea
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The Split Pea brothers always argued over the best direction to fire—forward or backward. But now they've found a clever solution: just let the peas rebound. Problem solved!</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Peas shoot peas forward and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Peas shot backwards will bounce and move forwards.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Repeater + Peashooter</color></size>

plants.name: Windgourd
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>For Windgourd, looking good is a top priority. He never leaves home without first spending a solid half hour perfecting the leaves on his head, ensuring his style is flawless.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Every so often a Blover will spawn to blow away the fog.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a Blover every 30 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Blover + Pumpkin</color></size>

plants.name: Pumpkin Lure
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Dining out sends shivers down Pumpkin Lure's spine. He's always fearful that the iron cutlery will magically stick to his face, turning an enjoyable meal into an awkward experience.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=33>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Magnet System: </color><color=#8B0000>This plant will deal:
(20 * Amount of Magnetic Plants in System * Zombie Speed) to specific zombies every 6 Seconds. Only Zombies with magnetable materials OR mechanical vehicles can be damaged this way. Also, they must not be on the sky or underground.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Pumpkin + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Starlure
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Starlure harbors a lifelong dream: to suck the stars from the sky. He spends every night staring at the starry heavens, imagining the day when his dream becomes reality.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can fuse with iron materials from zombies to absorb their properties.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals double damage to iron zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Starfruit + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Starjoker
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Starjoker often bore the burden of being seen as a circus clown, which left him feeling discontented. "I may appear comical, but I am, in fact, a superhero," he declared. "I commandeered the zombie's Jack-in-the-Box and put on the hero suit inside!" Perhaps the Magnet-shroom who aided him in the heist never mentioned where the box came from.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Shoots out stars that explode on contact.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*5/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Stars explode to deal a small splash damage upon contact.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Starfruit + Magnet-shroom) + Jack-in-the-Box (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Starpick
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"It's remarkably pickaxe-like," Starpick commented, a hint of amusement in his tone. "I can feel part of myself nestled in the ground, and it's quite pleasant—unless you're bothered by insects like centipedes." With a cheeky smile, he challenged, "Why not take off my hat? You'll find I'm even more pickaxe-like than you!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starpick hides underground: zombies will not attack it.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Cannot be attacked.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Starfruit + Magnet-shroom) + Pickaxe (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Starsteel
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>People often use the headshots of Starsteel and Starlure to hype up their relationship, which greatly troubles both of them. In fact, Starsteel just wants to be himself - a star with a heart of stone that is hard to rust.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires stars lined with a metallic coating.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40*5/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back on contact. Deals immense damage to Iron Zombies, and break iron doors.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Starfruit + Magnet-shroom) + Bucket (In Order)</color></size>

plants.name: Steel Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I wish I were stronger," Steel Pumpkin muses. "Maybe if I were made of diamond..." Starsteel smirks and replies, "Even that wouldn't be enough! You'd need to be netherite!" In their spirited banter, they forget a vital truth: they can enchant their own strengths.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Protects your plants with sturdy iron.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Pumpkin + Magnet-shroom) + Bucket</color></size>

plants.name: Joker Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Whenever I emerge, it signals the arrival of the clown. Everyone wonders what lies within his box, but the outcome remains a mystery. I caught a glimpse once, and that moment changed everything for me."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block explosions caused by Jack-in-the-Box zombies

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Nullifies the explosion damage of the Jack-in-the-Box, protecting the plant inside.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Pumpkin + Magnet-shroom) + Jack-in-the-Box</color></size>

plants.name: Miner Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Pumpkin is frequently used to protect the plants in the back from being attacked by miners. Curious about stopping the miners from drilling into the ground, he picked up their pickaxes and studied them. Ultimately, he developed new technology that forces miners to dig their way out of the ground in advance.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can block mining attempts by Digger Zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Forces Digger Zombies to unearth prematurely.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>(Pumpkin + Magnet-shroom) + Pickaxe</color></size>

plants.name: Magled-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>"Honestly, I wish I could be a simple Magnet-shroom," Magled-shroom confessed. "That way, I wouldn't have to be in the spotlight constantly or feel the pressure of using one magnet to do the work of two."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Attraction range and cooldown time improves depending on the Lumos Level.

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds (LL0) → 11 Seconds → 7.5 Seconds → 5 Seconds (LL3)</color>
<color=black>Magnet Range: </color><color=#8B0000>+1 (LL1) → +2 → +3</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Higher Lumos Levels will significantly shorten the attraction interval and increase the attraction range. When it's Lumos Level 2, the attraction will cause 200 damage to zombies near the attraction target.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Sea Magne-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The other sea-shrooms couldn't comprehend why Sea Magne-shroom could absorb iron to become bigger and taller. "It's simple: E=mc²," he explained, even if most of the energy was lost in the air and went completely unused.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>That's weird... Why does the magnet get bigger as well as he grows?

<color=black>Magnet Interval: </color><color=#8B0000>15 Seconds → 10 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Grows after attracting 3 times.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sea-shroom + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Magblover
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The plants often call Magblover "Magneto." He confidently casts his favorite spell, "Disarmament!" at the zombies, even though he has no idea how the conversion of wind energy to magnetic energy works behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Suck away all the iron objects present.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attract up to 10 iron objects.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Blover + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Magnethorn
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Magnethorn spent some time studying communications jamming at the Air Force Academy, often bragging to his friends about his stellar grades. What he doesn't realize is that his success was mostly thanks to his father, a high-ranking Air Force commander pulling strings behind the scenes.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=34>Can cause high damage to flying objects.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals double the damage to metallic armor. Dealing a certain amount of damage to Airships can cause it to crash, making it deal 1000 damage to zombies near the crash site.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cactus + Magnet-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Stardrop
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black></color></size>
plants.info:
<size=30>Summons a meteor that deal devastating damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60*5/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Lumos levels 1 to 3 has the same effect as Starglow. Upon hitting Lumos Level 4, summons another type of meteor that has a separate cooldown from the original meteor.</color>
<color=#495057>Magnetic System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each plant connected to the Magnetic System will increase the damage of the stars by 5%.
<color=#6A0C9D>Both systems can increase the damage of the stars by upto 120, maximum.
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Summons a meteor that hit the ground and explode into stars every 60 seconds. The cooldown can be reduced by connecting other Stardrops together, upto 13 for an improved cooldown of 25 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Plantern + Magnet-shroom + Starfruit</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Exclusive Buff: </color><color=#8B0000>All Meteors' attack cooldowns are halved | Gravitron Sub-species Unlocked</color></size>

plants.name: Snow Repeater
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Whatever happened to you?" a curious plant asked Snow Repeater. He chuckled softly and said, "I'm still a Repeater at heart. I just forgot to snuggle under a blanket during winter nights."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots two frozen peas in succession.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*2/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Repeater + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Gatling Snow
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"His hands are cold, his face is cold, his heart is cold, and even his blood is cold… Is he frozen?" someone wondered aloud. Gatling Snow shivered, reassuring the concerned plants, "I'm not frozen! The barrel of my machine gun is still burning hot!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Gatling Snow shoot four frozen peas at a time.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*4/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Gatling Pea + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Split Snow
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Don't let his icy facade mislead you; there could be a hidden warmth," someone suggested. But Digger Zombie sneered, "Don't make foolish assumptions. This guy has nothing but cold sides!"</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots frozen peas forwards and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20*3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Split Pea + Ice-shroom</color></size>

plants.name: Split Cherry
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Cherryshooter crawled out of the trench, bewildered. "Who threw that bomb?" he demanded. "Sorry, brother," Split Cherry replied sheepishly, "I saw you pointing your gun at us and thought you were a zombie."</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Split Cherry shoot cherries forward and backwards.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60*3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Split Pea + Cherry Bomb</color></size>

plants.name: Sniper Pea
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Admired for his sharp vision and robust strength, Sniper Pea is cherished by his Pea comrades. However, during their formation marches, his gun barrel often finds its way into the backs of their heads, making for some tense moments along the way.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=36>Snipes zombies all over the map to deal massive damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>500/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Headshot once every 6 attacks, insta-killing zombies.</color></size>
plants.cost: <size=36><color=#6A0C9D>Usage Condition: Large Map Tower Defense Modes</color></size>

plants.name: Bloverthorn Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Bloverthorn Pumpkin always kept three books on its shelf, their titles concealed from the curious eyes of the other plants. One day, a Thornball's curiosity led it into the study, where it uncovered the titles: "Guide to Succulent Plant Cultivation," "Postpartum Care for Pumpkins," and "30-Second Cactus Quick Flight Tutorial." The Thornball chuckled at the unexpected collection.</color></size>
plants.info:
<size=32>Spawns a Thornball that moves around the field to attack flying zombies.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Always has a Thornball wingman with him when he appears. Generates a Thornball on top of a 3x3 grid regularly.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Pumpkin + Cactus + Blover</color></size>

plants.name: Solar-Pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Some people ask why Solar-pult's little Suns disappear when thrown over the roof's right side. Solar-pult just smiles: "Where do you think the front yard's Suns comes from?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches solar cabbages to attack zombies and can also generate Sun.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50/5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Returns 100 Sun upon fusion. Each shot bounces once after hitting a zombie. For every 200 Sun, it can bounce one more time; when it hits a zombie or the ground, it drops 5 Sun.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Sunflower</color>

plants.name: Cabbage Pot
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"I'm not just a pot to hold cabbages, and Cabbage-pult is not the weakest plant! Cabbage-pult and I are best buddies," Cabbage Pot says confidently. Their friendship might have come to be because... one of them is balding, and the other is already bald.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides a 50% attack speed bonus to Cabbage-type plants above it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Grants a 50% attack speed boost to Cabbage-type plants.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Flower Pot</color>

plants.name: Taco-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Taco-pult always wonders why, despite learning skills from Kernel-pult and performing well on the battlefield, Dave finds it hard to look at him and even avoids him. In truth, it's because Taco-pult resembles a taco too much, and every time Dave sees him, he just wants to pick him up and eat him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches tacos that can bounce once, and can also throw butter.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles bounce once. Has a 1/4 chance to throw butter, dealing 80 damage and immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Kernel-pult</color>

plants.name: Kernel Pot
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Kernel Pot believes he's more than just delicious. In his view, buttered corn provides more nutrients than soil, especially for fungi. Kernel Pot's favorite plant is the Kernel-pult, his favorite food is butter, his favorite container is a cup, and his favorite song is "Buttercup."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Increases the butter chance of all Kernel-type plants above it from 25% to 50%.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Raises the butter chance from 1/4 to 1/2.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Flower Pot + Kernel-pult</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Husk
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>"Protecting the plants around me is my duty." As a professional cosplayer, "Umbrella Husk" is so skilled that no one realizes he's actually a corn cob with a butter wig, who loves to stand on his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=32>Knocks back zombies that try to approach and immobilizes them with butter.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies and immobilizes them for 4 seconds; knockbacks reduces its Toughness:
1 Zombie: -100 HP
2~4 Zombies: -150 HP
5 or more Zombies: -250 HP</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Kernel-pult + Umbrella Leaf</color>

plants.name: Winter Melon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Winter Melon once confessed to Melon-pult, "I wasn't always this frosty. I just went into the freezer for a popsicle one day, and… well, here we are." </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches frosty melons that slow zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>Applies 50 Cryo Points to zombies hit. Zombies hit in the splash area gain 5 Cryo Points. Deals 4x damage to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Melon-pult + Ice-shroom</color>

plants.name: Clove-pult
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>"In the 90's, people widely believed that the best way to deal with zombies was with cornmeal and black dog blood. For us plants, garlic is a strategic resource," Clove-pult says with a wise demeanor.</color>
plants.info:
<size=30>Has a chance to throw garlic butter that immobilizes zombies for 4 seconds and forces them to change lanes, while accumulating Poison Points to apply the Poisoned Debuff.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Poison System: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack accumulates 1 Poison Point, maxing at 5. At 5 points, the Poisoned Debuff is applied. Has a 1/4 chance to throw garlic butter, immobilizing zombies for 4 seconds, forcing lane switch, and removing the cap on Poison Points. Zombies lose (20 × Poison Point) HP / second while poisoned.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Kernel-pult + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Garbage-pult
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>"The combination of cabbage and garlic is fresh, delicious, and healthy, and it's simple to make. Adding a few cloves of garlic before serving enhances the flavor," explains Chef Garlic. Eating garlic is also said to have some effect on preventing hair loss.</color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Launches a projectile that bounces once, and each time it hits a zombie with Poison Points greater than 0, it can bounce again. There is no limit to bounce times, and each hit adds 1 Poison Point.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each zombie hit adds 1 Poison Point. See Clove-pult for details.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Garlic-pult
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Few dare to put on airs in front of Garlic-pult. Most take a detour when they see him, though he doesn't intend to be intimidating. He no longer seeks the popularity he had as a chef, but he does hope to make friends who appreciate the benefits of allicin. Now, plants finally embrace his unique charm, garlic and all.</color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Accumulates 1 Poison Point for all zombies within the garlic's splash radius; each Poison Point adds 5 damage to splash attacks.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each hit adds 1 Poison Point to the target; refer to Clove-pult.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Garlic + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Cob Cannon
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Cob Cannon is quite the intellectual powerhouse—rumor has it that it studied at Harvard and once worked at a prestigious law firm in New York. Known for its immense power, a single shot from Cob Cannon can decimate a large area of zombies. However, the true source of its formidable energy remains a mystery.</color>
plants.info:
<size=33>Can be manually fired to launch deadly corn cobs that cause cremator damage.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Must be planted on top of two Kernel-pults.</color>

plants.name: Corn-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Corn-pult is often seen frowning. When asked why, he says nothing. "People keep asking me if Buttered Corn is sticky or sweet," Corn-pult sighs. "Why ask me? I don't eat it. Only the zombies would know."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws large corns at the zombies; sometimes they're buttered.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a Buttered Corn, immobilizing the main target for 4 seconds and zombies in the splash range for (4 / total splash spread) seconds (minimum of 0.5).</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Melon-pult + Kernel-pult</color>

plants.name: Pyro Cannon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Pyro Cannon has a booming popcorn business. The fiery aroma sends zombies running, adding a sizzle to any event. It's even considering a hot pot session with Jalapeno soon.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire an explosive, high-damage flaming projectile that scorches zombies and infuses nearby plants with Jalapeno.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 (Cremator), inflicts the Enflamed Debuff</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Infuses plants in its blast radius with Jalapeno.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cob Cannon + Jalapeno</color>

plants.name: Cryo Cannon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Despite his icy exterior, Cryo Cannon is warmhearted, especially to friends. In his free time, he enjoys skiing, drumming, and exploring caves. His best party trick? A cold joke to "chill" the crowd.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to fire a freezing projectile that damages zombies and infuses plants with Ice-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator), Slows</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Infuses plants in its blast radius with Ice-shroom.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cob Cannon + Ice-shroom</color>

plants.name: Stuffed Melon
plants.introduce:
<size=36><color=black>"Peel away the green exterior, and you'll find a heart of roses within." This phrase means don't randomly walk into an unfamiliar barber shop—it will be a mind-blowing decision.

Melon Pot: "After finishing a watermelon, wearing its rind on your head is something everyone did as a kid." Flower Pot remarks, "Honestly, it's kind of silly."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires melons that bounce once.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Melon Pot
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Frugal Melon Pot can't stand to see Melon-pult throw melons without a thought for cost, so after defeating the zombies, Melon Pot secretly collects the shattered melon fragments scattered on the ground. "This is called soilless cultivation," Melon Pot explained. "Not just any plant can be grown in the ground here; every inch of soil is precious."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doubles the splash damage of melons above it, with no falloff; damage remains at 2/3 of base damage.

<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Flower Pot + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Salad-pult
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"When I was little, everyone asked what kind of Pult I wanted to be," says Salad-pult. "They thought you couldn't have it all. But I decided I wanted everything—even back then."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can catapult mixed projectiles in rapid succession.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>140/5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>42% chance of rapid-firing. Projectiles split into a mix of corn kernels (1/4 chance for butter) and cabbages upon hitting zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Kernel-pult + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Clove
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>"Come, give Umbrella Clove a hug. You focus on opening the door; let Umbrella Clove handle the rest! The RV doesn't matter; it's the brains inside that count!" Umbrella Clove says. "And one more thing—fight zombies with zombies! And pour some tea for Umbrella Clove while you're at it! Zombies, zombies, go away!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Knocks back zombies and forces them to switch lanes.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Knocks back nearby zombies, forcing them to change lanes; each knockback reduces its Toughness. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Garlic + Umbrella Leaf</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Kale
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>When asked about her secret to success, Umbrella Kale replied, "Actually, I just really enjoy letting balls rest on my head." She paused, "But the other plants all praise me as a top-notch protector."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can bounce catapult-type projectiles. If there are no zombies, it can store projectiles for a while and significantly boosts their damage.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Prioritized by catapults for targeting and increases projectile damage by 80%, knocks back approaching zombies and loses Toughness each time. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cabbage-pult + Umbrella Leaf</color>

plants.name: Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Some may not realize it, but Wall-nuts have inventors in their community. Inspired by zombie weaponry, they built their own war machines. "Zombie technology, ironically, only destroys itself," says Mecha-nut.</color>
plants.info:
<size=32>Can receive attributes from Jalapeno or Ice-shroom, with effects upon death.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Changes form when affected by Ice-shroom or Jalapeno, healing 3000 Toughness upon transformation; releases the current form's effects upon death. Absorbs damage to other plants in a 3*3 radius, and healing can exceed max HP (up to 4x). Restores 1000 HP to each Mecha-nut when zombie drops disappear and no Giga Mecha-nuts are present.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Mecha Fragments</color>

plants.name: Garlic Pot
plants.introduce: <size=35><color=black>Garlic Pot has long wanted to help the plants in its pot get a thorough sterilization, especially those on the front lines in direct contact with zombies. However, it seems only garlic-type plants are willing to grow in its pot. "Some plants would rather face zombies than catch my garlic smell," Garlic Pot sighed. "Now I can only use garlic to disinfect garlic, and they just say it's a perfect match."</color>
plants.info:
<size=35>Reduces the biting damage taken by garlic-type plants on top, and has a garlic effect itself.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Forces zombies to move towards the middle row.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Flower Pot + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Rind
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>"Give me a melon; I'll repay you with kindness." Umbrella Rind has always admired this saying from ancient poetry. Plants don't need to bribe him for help—whatever they give, he returns. Well, except basketballs. He's a total basketball fan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Deflects basketballs and returns a catapulted melon.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>2000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Can reflect zombie projectiles, including explosions, but loses 200 health each time. Each reflection stores energy equal to the projectile's damage, releasing it all on zombies for extra damage when the knockback occurs; with each knockbacks also loses Toughness. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Umbrella Leaf + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Melon Cannon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Melon Cannon is a fervent advocate of the "overwhelming firepower" doctrine: "If one shot doesn't do it, try two, three, or even four!" This approach has made it a powerhouse on the battlefield—and a hit at summer parties.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Use manually to launch a barrage of melons from above.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>200 / Melon. Up to 40 melons in a 3x3 area without falloff. Randomly hits within a 5x3 grid.</color>
<color=black>Arming Time: </color><color=#8B0000>36 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Cob Cannon + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Pot
plants.introduce: Other flower pots are puzzled by the dense foliage of Umbrella Pot, but Umbrella Pot simply says, "I just read the book The Pot's Guide to Hair Care."
plants.info:
<size=34>Enhances umbrella-type plants.

<color=black>Umbrella Husk:</color> <color=#8B0000>+2 Seconds immobilization, +50% knockback distance</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Rind:</color> <color=#8B0000>Doubles damage of reflected projectiles</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Clove, Silver/Golden Umbrella, Alchemist Umbrella & Midas Umbrella: </color><color=#8B0000>Doubles knockback distance</color>
<color=black>Umbrella Kale:</color> <color=#8B0000>Can attack zombies on adjacent lanes</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Flower Pot + Umbrella Leaf</color>

plants.name: Silver Cabbage
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Besides a shiny silver exterior, Silver Cabbage also has a heart of silver. Silver Cabbage dreams of becoming a teacher and already has a catchphrase in mind: "Silver Cabbage Instructor, at your service."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver cabbages to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Marigold + Cabbage-pult</color>

plants.name: Golden Cabbage
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Golden Cabbage isn't just about its dazzling appearance—it has a heart of pure gold. It relishes fighting alongside plants against zombies and dreams of one day being honored as the "Heroic Cabbage of Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attacks zombies by throwing golden cabbages. Its ultimate move unleashes cabbages on all zombies!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; throws a cabbage at every zombie, instantly killing those with health below 300.</color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>1000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Silver Pot
plants.introduce: "People are always saying 'gold this, silver that,' as if we have a hierarchy," Silver Pot said. "Marigold is silver, yet it's still called a Marigold." His words might have been more convincing if his gaze weren't fixed on the coffee bean by the roof's edge.
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra coins for you.

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Flower Pot + Marigold</color>

plants.name: Golden Pot
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"Many wealthy folks treat money like dirt, but I'm different," Golden Pot explains. "That's how I became rich in the first place."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra coins and amplifies the ultimate ability of any golden plant above it.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When you trigger an ultimate of a Golden Plant above it, all Golden Plants on other Golden Pots with an equal or less ultimate cost trigger their ultimates too. </color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>2000 Coins; each existing Golden Pot will increase the cost exponentially.</color>

plants.name: Silver Kernel
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>"Why throw silver coins at zombies? Why, why? Even if zombies are just game data, we still ought to show them some final respects." Silver Kernel was once an usher in a theater, but after discovering his knack for lecturing, he entered the world of public speaking, bringing along his butter and corn kernels.</color>
plants.info:
<size=33>Fires silver kernels and silver money bags to attack zombies, with a chance to earn coins.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 1/4 chance to throw a silver money bag, dealing 60 damage, immobilizing the zombie for 4 Seconds, and dropping 25 coins.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Kernel-pult + Marigold</color>

plants.name: Golden Kernel
plants.introduce: <size=33><color=black>Golden Kernel ponders words like "golden phrases" and "precious gems." But maybe true treasure lies in imported butter and gold missiles... or "Just Gold."</color>
plants.info:
<size=33>Throws golden kernels and butter at zombies, with a chance to generate coins. Its ultimate fires golden poppin' popcorns at zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>25% chance to throw a money bag, dealing 80 damage, stunning zombies for 4 Seconds, and dropping 100 coins.</color>
<color=black><color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 3500 Coins; launches four golden corn bombs, each dealing 450 damage in a 3x3 area without damage falloff.</color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>2000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Twin Marigold
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>"It's time to make gold coins!" one of the Twin Marigold sister declares. But the other sister insists, "Now's the perfect time for a silver coin!" Since they can never agree, they each produce their own share independently, which might actually be for the best. "Double opinions, double efficiency—isn't that right?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces double the amount of coins!

<color=black>Coin Output: </color><color=#8B0000>Generates coins twice every 20 seconds, otherwise identical to Marigold.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Marigold + Marigold</color>

plants.name: Silver Melon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Silver Melon sometimes considers itself the most valuable melon—until it remembers the more prestigious Golden Melon. "A melon is a melon, whether it's silver, gilded, or made with garlic or gold," Silver Melon chuckles. "We all have our place in the soil."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches silver melons to attack zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Marigold + Melon-pult</color>

plants.name: Golden Melon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Golden Melon doesn't mind questions about its golden rind and seeds, but never ask if it's seedless—it has no patience for that question.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls golden melons at zombies; its ultimate rains golden melons across the screen.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>240/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 2500 Coins; launches 60 golden melons, each dealing 120 damage, landing randomly across the screen.</color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>3000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Silver Umbrella
plants.introduce: <size=34><color=black>Silver Umbrella is always anxious about someone stealing his money when he's away, so he carries his fortune with him everywhere—even into battle against zombies. He thinks this keeps his wealth safe, but it only adds new risks. "That's my money; you can't take it!" he complains, though no one ever listens.</color>
plants.info:
<size=34>Generates extra money for you when it deflects basketballs.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 25 coins each time it activates, knocks back approaching zombies and loses Toughness each time. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Umbrella Leaf + Marigold</color>

plants.name: Golden Umbrella
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Golden Umbrella doesn't like this place—after a mishap in the water, it was shipped here alongside Silver Umbrella. The memory still frustrates him. "It's unfair! Why am I the freebie here?"</color>
plants.info:
<size=32>Deflects basketballs, generating extra coins, and its ultimate move can knock airborne imps and repel all nearby zombies.

<color=#3D1400>Toughness: </color><color=red>1000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Drops 50 Coins every time it deflects a basketball, knocks back approaching zombies and loses Toughness each time. See Umbrella Husk.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 2000 coins; knocks back all nearby zombies, drops 25 coins / zombie, yeets airborne imps, and drops 3 diamonds.</color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>1000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Silver Garlic
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Does a garlic made of silver still smell like garlic? Probably not, but neither the plants nor the zombies were eager to test it. However, zombies soon regretted their curiosity after a taste!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Possibly an even more pungent garlic? Maybe.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Marigold + Garlic</color>

plants.name: Golden Garlic
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Beneath its dazzling exterior lies an unbearable garlic scent. Golden Garlic muses, "True value is only in appearance, not in the details." But everyone knows this "golden" garlic is just a regular garlic with a shiny coat.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A stronger, gold-scented garlic that can force all zombies in front to switch lanes with its ultimate move.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>900</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; forces all zombies in its lane to change lanes.</color>
<color=black>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>1000 Coins</color>

plants.name: Hypno-nut
plants.introduce: <size=30><color=black>Hypno-nut has a soft spot for zombies: "There's something oddly pleasant about the way they nibble on me. It's not like scratching an itch… let's just call it affection from prolonged contact," it says, philosophically.</color>
plants.info:
<size=30>Charms zombies and summons a Charmed Mystery-box Zombie every 30 Seconds!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time it's bitten, there's a 4% chance to charm the zombie. Additionally, it can recover 100 health when hit by a Trippy-shroom spore, and stores one spore of that color each time it's hit (up to 3). When it collects 7 different spore colors, it consumes one of each and summons a Charmed Golden Mystery-box Zombie, then fully heals.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Hypno-shroom</color>

plants.name: Alchemist Umbrella
plants.introduce: <size=32><color=black>Alchemist Umbrella is a tycoon among plants, providing jobs for zombies and plants alike. "I maximize their value," it declares with a gilded flourish to its spectacles.</color>
plants.info:
<size=32>High-risk, high-reward!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the traits of both Umbrella Clove and Golden Umbrella.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 2500 Coins; knocks back all nearby zombies, turning those with less than 25% HP into silver statues worth 1000 coins, or gold statues worth 3000 coins if below 10% HP. Zombies without statues drop coins directly.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Golden Garlic + Umbrella Leaf (or Golden Umbrella + Garlic)</color>

plants.name: Summer Melon
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The plants always feel that red-rinded watermelons carry the festive vibe of New Year, crackling and popping with excitement. But the watermelon explains, 'I didn’t put firecrackers in the melon! It’s just that sealed food explodes when heated—and you can’t rush eating a hot watermelon!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs blazingly hot melons!

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>160/3 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inflicts Enflamed debuff.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Melon-pult + Jalapeno</color>

plants.name: Gold Magnet
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>After working countless hours at an accoutant firm, the Gold Magnet realized its terrifying attracting potential and switched careers to become a fighter. 'Honestly, this is way more fun than counting money,' it remarks. 'After all, money doesn't grow on trees, but they do somehow from crops.' That said, its plant companions often end up suffering from its antics.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Attracts projectiles!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attracts straight-shooting projectiles from adjacent lanes and produces a 25 Coin for every projectile attracted.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Magnet-shroom + Marigold</color>

plants.name: Giga Mecha-nut
plants.introduce: <size=31><color=black>Giga Mecha-nut has always been passionate about environmental protection. 'I have a love-hate relationship with zombies—they pollute the environment, but they also bring me wealth. Isn’t owning property and a trailer the hallmark of success? The lawn is clean all thanks to me!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=31>It might just be another fish ball. Who knows?

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>When zombie metal drops disappear, restores 8000 HP to all Giga Mecha-nuts on the field. Using a Wall-nut on it restores 8000 HP instantly and summons a Sharkmarine. Healing can exceed max HP. Has the same anti-crush property as Cherrizilla; damage received capped at 8000 per hit. Redirects damage to itself in a 3x3 area.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Wall-nut + Giga Mecha Fragments</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Buck-shroom has a constant worry: he’s terrified of Magnet-shroom accidentally pulling him in. 'Where did my screws go?' As Crazy Dave walks up, it seems he is about to have a brand-new concern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Buck-shrooms can knockback zombies too.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/2 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles knockback zombies and destroy screen doors with ease.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Pea-shroom + Bucket</color>

plants.name: Split Pea-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>The front head declares, 'My turn to use the eyebrow!' The back head replies, 'Guess we’ll have to split it.' Born just two minutes apart, their eternal battle over the eyebrow shows no signs of stopping.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots peas both forward and backward.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20x3/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Backward peas rebound if no zombie is hit.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Puff-shroom + Peashooter * 3</color>

plants.name: Solar Magnet
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>Have you heard? Solar Magnet's been glowing with wealth lately! 'I don’t produce iron; I just do the delivery,' he says proudly. 'This is all from years of hard work.' Word is, he’s even opened business beyond the lawn!' </color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Produces metal objects and turns metal objects to sun.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Produces a random metal object every 30 Seconds. Spend a metal object on it and it will produce 25 sun.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Sunflower + Magne-shroom</color>

plants.name: Golden Spikeweed
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>总有人分不清火炬生产的地刺和普通地刺的区别，但火炬地刺本身很清楚：这再明显不过了，我让他们所走的道路成为了一条更加阳光明亮的康庄大道。</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>火焰地刺？他也许跟地刺没有太多区别。

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>？</color>
<color=black>

plants.name: Golden Kelp
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>火焰缠绕水草一直泡在水里，但这压根不影响它给植物们烤海带吃。呃，味道很奇怪就是了。</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>火焰缠绕水草？他也许跟缠绕水草没有太多区别。

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>？</color>
<color=black>

plants.name: Charm Magnet
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>After countless days and nights of research, Charm Magnet finally mastered the art of the magnetic charm field. 'Now I can better persuade zombie friends to fight alongside us,' he said. 'Some think I threaten them with metal tools, but one day, the truth will come to light.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes metal objects and summon the corresponding zombies to fight for you.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Uses metal objects to spawn hypnotized zombies, auto-uses metals generated from Solar Magnet behind itself and those consumed by Magnet-shrooms in the same Magnetic System.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypno-shroom + Magnet-shroom</color>

plants.name: Lure-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>'I used to ferment bread,' Lure-shroom explained, 'but now I collect metal to build the bread ovens.'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Putting an Iron Bucket on him might have interesting results.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals twice the damage to metallic zombies.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Magnet-shroom</color>

plants.name: Rust-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>'I got canned again!' Cries Rust-shroom who used to be Lure-shroom just a moment ago, 'All I did was accidentally making a coffee maker rather than an oven!'</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>There could be another twist if you give him a Rugby Helmet?

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals thrice the damage to armors.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Magnet-shroom + Bucket</color>

plants.name: Rugby-shroom
plants.introduce: <size=36><color=black>'I've always dreamed of being a rugby player, and now I've finally got this hat of glory,' said Rugby-shroom proudly. 'But today, I've decided to take a break on the sidelines.' In reality, he's just a stadium security, keeping the overenthusiastic fans out with his spores.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Sprays fumes that penetrate all kinds of armor!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/1.5 Seconds</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals damage to armor and the zombie in the armor at the same time.</color>
<color=black>Fusion Formula: </color><color=#8B0000>Fume-shroom + Magnet-shroom + Bucket + Rugby Helmet</color>
